faq.question: Will my images be stored on your servers?

faq.question: Can this AI enhance old or damaged photos?

faq.question: How is this different from the AI Image Upscaler?
faq.answer: The Photo Enhancer focuses on improving image quality (colors, sharpness, noise) while keeping the same resolution. The Upscaler increases image size. For best results, enhance first, then upscale.

faq.question: Will my enhanced photos look over-processed?

faq.question: What's the difference between image enhancer and photo enhancer?
faq.answer: They're essentially the same - both use AI to improve image quality. The Photo Enhancer is optimized specifically for photographs with additional focus on skin tones and portraits, while the Image Enhancer works well on all image types including graphics, documents, and photos.

faq.question: Can AI enhancement fix severely blurry images?
faq.answer: AI can significantly improve blurry images by adding sharpness and detail, but there are limits. Moderately blurry images see excellent results. Severely out-of-focus images will improve but may not become perfectly sharp. For best results, combine enhancement with upscaling.

faq.question: Will enhancement make my images look artificial?
faq.answer: No. Our AI is specifically trained to produce natural-looking results. Unlike aggressive filters that create artificial 'HDR looks,' our enhancement preserves the authentic character of your images while improving quality.

faq.question: How many images can I enhance for free?
faq.answer: myimageupscaler.com includes 10 free credits to start. Each enhancement uses 1 credit. For unlimited access, check our affordable plans starting at $19/month.

faq.question: Can you really improve low-quality photos?
faq.answer: Yes! Our AI doesn't just stretch pixels - it intelligently reconstructs missing details based on patterns learned from millions of high-quality images. While it can't add information that was never there, it can dramatically improve perceived quality and resolution.

faq.question: Will this work on very old or damaged photos?
faq.answer: Absolutely. The Photo Quality Enhancer works great on scanned photos, old prints, and even damaged images. It can reduce scratches, restore faded colors, and improve sharpness on photos that are decades old.

faq.question: How is this different from just increasing image size?
faq.answer: Traditional resizing (like in Photoshop) simply stretches pixels, making images blurry and blocky. Our AI actually generates new detail and sharpens the image as it increases resolution, resulting in clear, natural-looking results.

faq.question: What file size can I upload?
faq.answer: You can upload images up to 25MB. This covers most photos and even some high-resolution scans. Larger files can be compressed before upload without affecting the enhancement quality.

faq.question: Can you fix severely blurry images?
faq.answer: AI clarity enhancement works best on moderately blurry images. Slight motion blur or soft focus can be corrected very effectively. Severely out-of-focus or heavily motion-blurred images will see improvement but may not become perfectly sharp. The AI does an impressive job, but it has physical limits.

faq.question: Will sharpening make my image look unnatural?
faq.answer: No. Our AI uses smart sharpening that only enhances edges and important details while keeping skin, skies, and smooth areas natural. This prevents the 'over-sharpened' look that comes from traditional sharpening tools.

faq.question: Does this work on text in images?
faq.answer: Yes! The clarity enhancer is excellent for sharpening text in screenshots, scanned documents, and photos of signs or pages. It makes text more readable without introducing artifacts.

faq.question: Can I enhance clarity and upscale at the same time?
faq.answer: Absolutely. For best results, we recommend using the clarity enhancer first, then upscaling. Or use our AI Image Upscaler which automatically applies both enhancements in one process.

faq.question: How is AI enlargement different from normal resizing?
faq.answer: Traditional resizing (like in Photoshop's Image Size) just stretches pixels, creating blur and pixelation. AI enlargement actually generates new detail by analyzing patterns in your image and reconstructing it at higher resolution, resulting in sharp, clear results.

faq.question: Can you really enlarge images 8x without quality loss?
faq.answer: Yes! Our AI doesn't just stretch pixels - it intelligently reconstructs the image at higher resolution. While it can't add information that was never captured, it can generate realistic details that make the enlarged image look natural and sharp, not blurry or pixelated.

faq.question: What's the largest size I can enlarge to?
faq.answer: You can enlarge up to 8x the original dimensions. For example, a 500x500px image can become 4000x4000px. If you need larger, you can download the 8x version and enlarge it again for even higher resolution.

faq.question: Will enlarged images work for professional printing?
faq.answer: Absolutely. AI-enlarged images meet professional print standards. Many of our users enlarge images to achieve 300 DPI at poster sizes and beyond, with excellent print results.

faq.question: Can I enlarge images for professional printing?
faq.answer: Yes! Our Image Enlarger is perfect for print preparation. Enlarge images to meet the standard 300 DPI requirement for professional printing. For example, to print an 8x10 inch photo at 300 DPI, you need 2400x3000 pixels - easily achieved with our enlarger.

faq.question: What's the maximum size I can enlarge to?
faq.answer: There's no practical limit. You can enlarge images to thousands of pixels in each dimension. However, keep in mind that extreme enlargement (10x+) from very small sources may show some quality limitations. For best results, we recommend AI-powered enlargement for factors above 4x.

faq.question: Will my enlarged images look blurry?
faq.answer: Our Image Enlarger uses quality-preserving algorithms to minimize blur. Small to moderate enlargements (2-4x) typically look excellent. For larger enlargements or when quality is critical, consider using our AI Image Enlarger which actively improves quality as it upscales.

faq.question: Can I enlarge logos and graphics with text?
faq.answer: Absolutely. The Image Enlarger works great for logos, graphics, and images with text. For critical business graphics, we recommend using our AI Image Enlarger which has specialized text-preservation algorithms for the sharpest possible results.
